progressively worse.  At baseline she has some dyspnea on
exertion with mild to moderate exertion.  It occurs with one
flight of stairs.  She now is complaining of shortness of
breath at rest.  She reports she also is having increasing
lower extremity edema for the last several weeks which had
responded to increasing doses of Lasix orally, initially 40
mg p.o. b.i.d., then 60 mg p.o. b.i.d., however, this was no
longer helping.  She was also complaining of fatigue and
several weeks of difficulty sleeping secondary to orthopnea.

no other change in medications recently, no change in her
diet, no history of coronary artery disease.  The patient
reports decreasing urine output for over the last four days.
No hematuria or dysuria.  No calf pain and no upper
respiratory symptoms.  In the Emergency Department the
patient was noted to be hypoxic with an oxygen saturation in
the mid 80s on room air.  She was 94% on 100% nonrebreather.
Her chest x-ray was consistent with congestive heart failure.
She was given Lasix 100 mg intravenously with clear urine
output around 280 cc and no change in symptoms.

### Clinical Note:
female patient in sixties prescribed Morphine Sulfate, Iso-Osmotic Dextrose, Vancomycin, Ipratropium Bromide Neb, HYDROmorphone (Dilaudid), Levofloxacin, MetRONIDAZOLE (FLagyl), Sodium Chloride 0.9%  Flush, Codeine Sulfate, Potassium Chloride, Morphine SR (MS Contin), 1/2 NS, Lorazepam, Quetiapine Fumarate, Piperacillin-Tazobactam Na, Acetaminophen, Valsartan, Fexofenadine, Albuterol 0.083% Neb Soln, Guaifenesin, Docusate Sodium, Heparin, traZODONE HCl, Senna, Aspirin, Pantoprazole, Amlodipine, Citalopram Hydrobromide, BusPIRone, Femhrt 1/5, Heparin Flush PICC (100 units/ml), OxycoDONE (Immediate Release) , NS, Midazolam, Fentanyl Citrate

NPN 7p-7a
Pt is 63y/o with recurrent PNA, htn, hypoxia and s/p bronch with newly diagnosed lung CA. Path results c/w bronchoalveolar CA. Oncology is following.

EVENTS: Early in shift, pt very anxious c/o uncontrolled pain and SOB. Pt sats down to 90% and placed on nonrebreather. Sats up to 96%. Pt on PCA dilaudid, but given an additional 2mg IVP with poor results. Pt then given 1mg IV Ativan, as well as standing Buspar/Trazadone/seroquel with very good effect. Pt able to then sleep about 3hrs. Around 1am, pt awoke anxious and SOB c/o increased pain. Pt used PCA and was given 1mg IV Ativan with good effect, and slept again for 3.5 hrs.

NEURO: Axiety appears to be trigger to SOB and then increased pain and guarding. Pt is very pleasant and appreciative, but reasonably uncomfortable. Pt given emotional support.

CV: NSR 70s-90s. BP 9
